column4: Hello, need help with getting working USB Sound device (Ubuntu 10.10, ALSA 1.0.24). Card shows in 'aplay -l' and 'pavucontrol', but no sound.
did you change the default output in the Preferences -> Sound
what USB sound card is this?
card also present in default Gnome output list as "Mackie XD-2 Analog stereo", checked as default, but no sound.
this sound card was working in previous installations of Ubuntu, thus somehow it's POSSIBLE to get it working
on my system I have it under System -> Preferences -> Sound -- then hardware tab, as well as output tab
I have it there too on my system, but no sound
even LEDs on Card itself don't work
anything in dmesg when you plug it in?  Some of these USB devices require a firmware blob to work
my vantec 7.1 USB just worked out of the box
that's alrady more complicated, now let's speak in command quotes) what should I type in terminal?
I switched "Profile" in Sound Preferences under my USB device, now it gone from Output list, an there's only Dummy Output. :'-(
I switched "Profile" to IEC958 and it returned back to Outpust list, but still now actual sound.
